conversation.message: [APPLY] Hello Company_A—I'm Seeker_E. I’m very interested in this role and believe I can contribute quickly with strong execution and collaboration. I’m ready to proceed immediately and would be excited to join your team. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is Company_C, but Company_C ranks me 4th (behind Seekers B, C, D), so an immediate [APPLY] risks rejection if higher-priority seekers apply this round. Company_D is my 2nd choice and ranks me 4th as well, but Company_A is my 3rd choice and ranks me 1st, making acceptance highly likely if I apply now. To maximize my chance of securing a high-ranked match early (and avoid ending up with my 4th/5th choices), I will apply to Company_A.

Although Seeker_B also applied and ranks #4 for us (even if Company_A is their top choice), there is no upside in delaying or risking losing Seeker_E to other companies—Seeker_E ranks Company_A third and may receive/accept offers elsewhere (e.g., Company_C is their #1 and Company_C ranks Seeker_E #4). Best action is to accept Seeker_E now.

Per rules, we must reject any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Even though Seeker_B ranks above Seeker_C on our list and has strong interest, we cannot accept without violating quota constraints.
